[[File:Jenny Dolfen - The Vanyar Leave for War.jpg|200px|thumb|''The Vanyar leave for war'' by [[Jenny Dolfen]]]]
The '''host of the Valar'''<ref name="silchap">{{Cite DTP|S QS.24.022}}</ref>, also called the '''Host of Valinor'''<ref>{{App|B}}, p. 1420</ref><ref name="silchap"/> or '''[[Host of the West (disambiguation)|Host of the West]]'''<ref>{{App|A3}}, p. 1407</ref><ref>{{Cite DTP|S QS.24.024}}</ref>, was the mighty army that overthrew [[Morgoth]] and his legions at the end of the [[First Age]].

The army itself was composed of [[Eönwë]], the herald of [[Manwë]]; possibly other [[Maiar]] and some of the [[Valar]];<ref group=note>No other [[Ainur]] are mentioned, but Eönwë's presence alone is an indication that other Maiar would accompany him, if not some Valar as well. This is implied by the name "Host of the Valar" itself as well as the cataclysmic result of the War which drowned [[Beleriand]]. Cf. {{HM|Guide}}, p. 202 and [[Michael Martinez]]'s [http://middle-earth.xenite.org/2012/10/10/how-was-beleriand-destroyed-in-the-war-of-wrath/ article]: " It would be reasonable to infer that some of the Valar also accompanied the Host — presumably [[Tulkas]] and [[Oromë]] would have wanted to be included in that conflict."</ref> the [[Noldor]] of [[Valinor]] under [[Finarfin]]; and the [[Vanyar]] under [[Ingwion]].<ref>{{WJ|Last}}</ref>

They were brought to [[Middle-earth]] by the ships of [[Falmari]], who took pity on the words of [[Elwing]]; however the Falmari refused to fight beside the Noldor, remembering the [[First Kinslaying]]. Once they landed, the Host of the Valar drove away the Orcs of the shores of the [[Belegaer]] in the [[Battle of Eglarest]].<ref>{{LR|AB}}</ref>

The Host of the West met Morgoth's host of the North in the titanic clash of the [[War of Wrath]]. Assisted by the [[Great Eagles]] and [[Earendil]], they were victorious.<ref>{{S|Earendil}}</ref>
